title: Where is chat timestamp on new client?
body: Maybe I'm just missing it completely. But I would Like a timestamp on my private messages. So if someone asks if I'm on and I didn't see it I know what time they said it. I've looked all over the new client and can't find it anywhere to turn on out of game private messages(Found the in-game ones)

replies.body: Timestamps are auto-enabled!  You just have to mouse over the DM, and it will show the date and time of the message.  Let me know if that clears things up!

Why would I have to mouse over the chat individually to check timestamps? It makes it harder to check timestamps for several messages you would receive when afk and doesn't really have a benefit other than having 3-4  less characters in the chat.

This feature is bad. It's clearly not a good user experience to have to hover over each message to know what time they've sent something. We come to get used to things in a certain way, just look how instant messaging works on our cellphones and Facebook. Take lessons from a proven model and give us the option to have it that way.

Pretty please add an option to permanently show timestamps and also add a divider between days in chat.
At the moment you have to hover each and every message if you want to know if they were sent continuously or with a break.
Messages can have days between them and they are shown as if they had happened directly after each other.

Google quickly showed me your solution, and now that I know it, I kind of like that feature. It looks cool!

But it's a bad sign that I had to google it and even worse that there is no option for it.
i am having the same problem, its frustrating!

I agree.
Timestamps should always be there.
I leave the client open and when I come back I want to know right away when were sent the messages I received. 
There should be at least an option to toggle it on/off.
